page.title: 17GERPINS LANE TIP
page.content:
The GLC Tip is situated in Upminster in Gerpins Lane. The refuse is sorted out into different containers: cardboard, paper, metals, rags, glass, oil and garden refuse. The tip can recycle: metal, rags, paper, cardboard, oil, glass, carpet and in future they are planning to recycle timber, tin and plastic. Toxic waste is taken by an inspector in a lorry, it's taken to a secret site and buried. It takes 500-1000 years to rot down. The tip was first used in l972 or earlier, it was modernized in March l984. The most cars come on Sunday, the record is 3000 plus. The most lorries come Saturday morning. Normal refuse goes to Ockendon to be recycled, bottles go to Harlow.
by pupils from BRANFIL SCHOOL.
